#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=EPILOGUE OF THE CIGAR DIVAN

#Text=On a certain day of lashing rain in the December of last year , and between the hours of nine and ten in the morning , Mr. Edward Challoner pioneered himself under an umbrella to the door of the Cigar Divan in Rupert Street .
#Text=It was a place he had visited but once before : the memory of what had followed on that visit and the fear of Somerset having prevented his return .
#Text=Even now , he looked in before he entered ; but the shop was free of customers .
#Text=The young man behind the counter was so intently writing in a penny version-book , that he paid no heed to Challoner ’s arrival .
#Text=On a second glance , it seemed to the latter that he recognised him .
#Text=‘ By Jove , ’ he thought , ‘ unquestionably Somerset ! ’
#Text=And though this was the very man he had been so sedulously careful to avoid , his unexplained position at the receipt of custom changed distaste to curiosity .
#Text=‘
#Text=“ Or opulent rotunda strike the sky , ” ’ said the shopman to himself , in the tone of one considering a verse .
#Text=‘ I suppose it would be too much to say “ orotunda , ” and yet how noble it were !
#Text=“ Or opulent orotunda strike the sky . ”
#Text=But that is the bitterness of arts ; you see a good effect , and some nonsense about sense continually intervenes . ’
#Text=‘ Somerset , my dear fellow , ’ said Challoner , ‘ is this a masquerade ? ’
#Text=‘ What ?
#Text=Challoner ! ’ cried the shopman .
#Text=‘ I am delighted to see you .
#Text=One moment , till I finish the octave of my sonnet : only the octave . ’
#Text=And with a friendly waggle of the hand , he once more buried himself in the commerce of the Muses .
#Text=‘ I say , ’ he said presently , looking up , ‘ you seem in wonderful preservation : how about the hundred pounds ? ’
#Text=‘ I have made a small inheritance from a great aunt in Wales , ’ replied Challoner modestly .
#Text=‘ Ah , ’ said Somerset , ‘ I very much doubt the legitimacy of inheritance .
#Text=The State , in my view , should collar it .
#Text=I am now going through a stage of socialism and poetry , ’ he added apologetically , as one who spoke of a course of medicinal waters .
#Text=‘ And are you really the person of the — establishment ? ’ inquired Challoner , deftly evading the word ‘ shop . ’
#Text=‘ A vendor , sir , a vendor , ’ returned the other , pocketing his poesy .
#Text=‘ I help old Happy and Glorious .
#Text=Can I offer you a weed ? ’
#Text=‘ Well , I scarcely like . . . ’ began Challoner .
#Text=‘ Nonsense , my dear fellow , ’ cried the shopman .

#Text=‘ We are very proud of the business ; and the old man , let me inform you , besides being the most egregious of created beings from the point of view of ethics , is literally sprung from the loins of kings .
#Text=“ De Godall je suis le fervent . ”
#Text=There is only one Godall .
#Text=— By the way , ’ he added , as Challoner lit his cigar , ‘ how did you get on with the detective trade ? ’
#Text=‘ I did not try , ’ said Challoner curtly .
#Text=‘ Ah , well , I did , ’ returned Somerset , ‘ and made the most incomparable mess of it : lost all my money and fairly covered myself with odium and ridicule .
#Text=There is more in that business , Challoner , than meets the eye ; there is more , in fact , in all businesses .
#Text=You must believe in them , or get up the belief that you believe .
#Text=Hence , ’ he added , ‘ the recognised inferiority of the plumber , for no one could believe in plumbing . ’
#Text=‘ A propos , ’ asked Challoner , ‘ do you still paint ? ’
#Text=‘ Not now , ’ replied Paul ; ‘ but I think of taking up the violin . ’

#Text=Challoner ’s eye , which had been somewhat restless since the trade of the detective had been named , now rested for a moment on the columns of the morning paper , where it lay spread upon the counter .
#Text=‘ By Jove , ’ he cried , ‘ that ’s odd ! ’
#Text=‘ What is odd ? ’ asked Paul .
#Text=‘ Oh , nothing , ’ returned the other : ‘ only I once met a person called M’Guire . ’
#Text=‘ So did I ! ’ cried Somerset .
#Text=‘ Is there anything about him ? ’
#Text=Challoner read as follows :
#Text=‘ Mysterious death in Stepney .
#Text=An inquest was held yesterday on the body of Patrick M’Guire , described as a carpenter .
#Text=Doctor Dovering stated that he had for some time treated the deceased as a dispensary patient , for sleeplessness , loss of appetite , and nervous depression .
#Text=There was no cause of death to be found .
#Text=He would say the deceased had sunk .
#Text=Deceased was not a temperate man , which doubtless accelerated death .
#Text=Deceased complained of dumb ague , but witness had never been able to detect any positive disease .
#Text=He did not know that he had any family .
#Text=He regarded him as a person of unsound intellect , who believed himself a member and the victim of some secret society .
#Text=If he were to hazard an opinion , he would say deceased had died of fear . ’
#Text=‘ And the doctor would be right , ’ cried Somerset ;
#Text=‘ and my dear Challoner , I am so relieved to hear of his demise , that I will — Well , after all , ’ he added , ‘ poor devil , he was well served . ’
#Text=The door at this moment opened , and Desborough appeared upon the threshold .

#Text=He was wrapped in a long waterproof , imperfectly supplied with buttons ; his boots were full of water , his hat greasy with service ; and yet he wore the air of one exceeding well content with life .
#Text=He was hailed by the two others with exclamations of surprise and welcome .
#Text=‘ And did you try the detective business ? ’ inquired Paul .
#Text=‘ No , ’ returned Harry .
#Text=‘ Oh yes , by the way , I did though : twice , and got caught out both times .
#Text=But I thought I should find my — my wife here ? ’ he added , with a kind of proud confusion .
